content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

In the main target image, I can see two distinct structures:

## Left Structure (Tower):
- Total blocks: 7 blocks
- Layers: 3 layers
- Arrangement:
  - Bottom layer: Two green vertical rectangular pillars with a yellow horizontal beam at the base
  - Middle layer: Two orange cylindrical columns with a yellow horizontal beam on top
  - Top layer: An orange triangular block placed on the yellow beam

## Right Structure (Stacked Blocks):
- Total blocks: 5 blocks
- Layers: 3 layers
- Arrangement:
  - Bottom layer: Red block with a circular hole/tunnel
  - Middle layer: Green rectangular block with two yellow half-cylinder shapes on top
  - Top layer: Red block with an arched opening

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

For the Left Structure:
- 2 × Block #6 (Green vertical rectangular block)
- 3 × Block #7 (Yellow horizontal rectangular beam)
- 2 × Block #9 (Orange cylindrical column)
- 1 × Block #14 (Orange triangular block)

For the Right Structure:
- 1 × Block #1 (Red block with arched opening facing forward)
- 1 × Block #2 (Red block with arched opening facing forward, slightly different)
- 1 × Block #5 (Green horizontal rectangular block)
- 2 × Block #10 (Yellow half-cylinder block)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 7
    Step2: Move block with index 6
    Step3: Move block with index 6
    Step4: Move block with index 7
    Step5: Move block with index 9
    Step6: Move block with index 9
    Step7: Move block with index 7
    Step8: Move block with index 14
    Step9: Move block with index 1
    Step10: Move block with index 5
    Step11: Move block with index 10
    Step12: Move block with index 10
    Step13: Move block with index 2
}
```

This assembly order first creates the left tower structure from bottom to top, then builds the right stacked structure from bottom to top.
